bug.author: kurt-rhee
bug.description:
<denchmark-h:h1>Summary</denchmark-h>
I have an issue where the checkbox always defaults to True. marine_matrix = st.sidebar.checkbox(label="Run Full Marine Matrix", value="False") <denchmark-h:h1>Steps to reproduce</denchmark-h>
marine_matrix = st.sidebar.checkbox(label="Run Full Marine Matrix", value="False")
Go to '...' Click on '....' Scroll down to '....'
<denchmark-h:h2>Expected behavior:</denchmark-h>
I would like this checkbox to show False instead of True <denchmark-h:h2>Actual behavior:</denchmark-h>
This checkbox shows True <denchmark-h:h2>Is this a regression?</denchmark-h>
I don't know. <denchmark-h:h1>Debug info</denchmark-h>
Streamlit version: 0.56 Python version: 3.6.9 Using Conda OS version: Windows 10 Browser version: Chrome
<denchmark-h:h1>Additional information</denchmark-h>
If needed, add any other context about the problem here. For example, did this bug come from <denchmark-link:https://discuss.streamlit.io>https://discuss.streamlit.io</denchmark-link> or another site? Link the original source here!

comments.comment:
Hi <denchmark-link:https://github.com/kurt-rhee>@kurt-rhee</denchmark-link> , thanks for the code snippet and for filing a new bug. I was able to reproduce your situation based on the line you provided, and then I realized that you can fix it by removing the quotation marks around the word "False"! In other words, replace your line like so: <denchmark-code>marine_matrix = st.sidebar.checkbox(label="Run Full Marine Matrix", value=False) </denchmark-code>
That fixed the issue for me. Let me know if it does for you as well.
